result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Kenneth L Fehrman was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge to probation.  Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Huber privileges subject to jail policies. Includes AODA and treatment release.

AMENDED 3/5/15: Court granted good time.

Ct 1, OWI 5th or 6th, BAC 5th or 6th.
Defendant Kenneth L Fehrman in court with attorney Mark P Murphy.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Information filed, reading waived.

Defendant Kenneth L Fehrman in court with attorney Mark P Murphy.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.

Defendant Kenneth L Fehrman in court with attorney Mark P Murphy.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead guilty to count one. Court accepted plea, found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld 3 yr. probation, conds: 12 month jail, huber, start today at 7 p.m., huber includes release from treatment/AODA. $3,468 fine. 36 mo. revocation. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample, $250 surcharge, 24 mo. IID upon licensure, not possess/consume alcohol. Court granted 3 days jail credit. Ct. 2 dismissed.
with absolute sobriety at all times, not operate motor vehicle without valid d.l.

Defendant Kenneth L Fehrman in court with attorney Mark P Murphy telephonically.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion for bond amendment by Atty Murphy. State takes no position. Court amended bond to absolute sobriety at all times, not operate motor vehicle without valid d.l.
Bail/bond hearing on August 6, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
